messages.content: Could somebody restart the "CI / Linux->Windows cross, no tests (pull_request)" task on https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29415? Looks like an unrelated failure: Could not connect to archive.ubuntu.com:80 (185.125.190.83), connection timed out
Thanks :)

After a couple of months I started my 29.0 node again, it is not syncing. I think this is the relevant part in the log on why it's not working: https://paste.sh/lYn_i-We#GMhMKJ36XEZLHToF-KcxUa0r . After this it's endless trying to connect to peers.
Jouke: looks like it has a corrupted chainstate, and thinks all blocks given to it by peers are invalid, disconnecting thrm
you may want to reindex, with the -reindex-chainstate command line option
[bitcoin] fjahr opened pull request #33306: index: Force database compaction in coinstatsindex (master...2025-09-csi-compaction) https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33306
lightlike might want to audit when (lack of) mapBlocksInFlight is doing anything. e.g., I think TipMayBeStale may become false often during background validation
sipa, thanks, will try that. Seems it has become corrupt while syncing? More complete log of that run here: https://paste.sh/DCplEmOf#7wNEoPTDAbpTAd1osp3N0sjy
Jouke: Error: That URL raised <HTTP Error 404: Not Found>
Jouke 99% of the time it's hardware/bit flip every time
sipa loving the more verbose logs for block script failures
shakes hand at hardware
*fist
more likely than an accidental interpreter softfork
interestingly, it's missing a UTXO that was created just a few blocks earlier, without any intervening disk flush
so it's really corrupted in memory
[qa-assets] maflcko merged pull request #236: ci: Turn persistent runners into GHA runners (main...main) https://github.com/bitcoin-core/qa-assets/pull/236
[qa-assets] maflcko pushed 2 commits to main: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/qa-assets/compare/c63a1a9d9bba...fc42e64f6e66
qa-assets/main fd2bd02 MarcoFalke: ci: Turn persistent runners into GHA runners
qa-assets/main fc42e64 maflcko: Merge pull request #236 from maflcko/main
it is just a consumer laptop, so Synchronous Unbuffered (Unregistered) RAM
Have you got a license for that RAM
I am trying to come up with a clever retort, but I guess my memory is failing me
sliv3r__: HeadersDirectFetchBlocks and BlockChecked in net_processing; potentially also SendMessages where it sets `sync_block_and_header_from_peer = true`

hi
#29675 got some review this week which I've addressed. Other than that, no updates.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/29675 | wallet: Be able to receive and spend inputs involving MuSig2 aggregate keys by achow101 · Pull Request #29675 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub

#topic Script Validation WG Update (fjahr)
hi
The focus is still on the secp PR (secp256k1#1134), no other new development otherwise that I am aware of.
https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/issues/1134 | Add an experimental batch module by siv2r · Pull Request #1134 · bitcoin-core/secp256k1 · GitHub
it's nice to see everyone again
#topic Kernel WG Update (TheCharlatan)
CodeShark: !
Pushed a change to #30595 reworking the C header's approach to ownership of data.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/30595 | kernel: Introduce initial C header API by TheCharlatan · Pull Request #30595 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
The approach taken now should both communicate when objects are only "views" into other objects.
Other than that, looking for some more conceptual review on #32317
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/32317 | kernel: Separate UTXO set access from validation functions by TheCharlatan · Pull Request #32317 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
that's all from my side.
hi
Hi
#topic Cluster Mempool WG Update (sdaftuar, sipa)
not too much to update right now
but good to see some review of the full clustermempool pr
that's it from me
#topic v30.0
Branch off is scheduled for this Saturday
please review the things in the milestone https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/milestone/72

achow101_: ok
I would like to volunteer to work on that
achow101_: add #33201 ?
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/33201 | Add functional test for IPC interface by sipa · Pull Request #33201 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
sipa: added
janb84: great! you should already have permissions to add to the dev wiki
janb84: thanks for taking on the testing guide again!
no worries :) and yes I have access, so should be good to go
achow101_: dank
Any other topics to discuss this week?
What are the blue highlights on the left of some issues on the milestone page?
hodlinator: means that there's new stuff in the issue you haven't seen yet
